result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erin Lashawn Mims

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Erin Lashawn Mims appeared by video.  Attorney Douglas J. Phebus appeared by video for Erin Lashawn Mims.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held. Parties are continuing negotiations and are requesting an additional status. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Erin Lashawn Mims not in court, in custody.  Attorney Victor M. Arellano in court for Erin Lashawn Mims.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material and an offer from the State. Defense advised the Court of possible resolution. State confirmed and requested an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 16. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Scheduling conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Erin Lashawn Mims in court with Attorney Victor M. Arellano; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

$1000.00 Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Any remaining cash bail on deposit to be returned to the surety.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Erin Lashawn Mims in court with attorney Victor M. Arellano.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Amount: $20.00
